name: Ex Machina: Tag Quiz | Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: The attack on Jackson Georges and Hundred was not staged.
questions.explanation:
False.

	To make sure that Hundred's technopathy was genuine, the National Security Agency staged an assault in which Hundred, in his Great Machine costume, had to defend himself.

questions.text: What is the name of the reporter who asks Hundred for dinner?
questions.explanation:
Suzanne Padilla.

	Suzanne Padilla asks for a dinner date with Mayor Hundred at Scouna, which he refused. With sucha  busy schedule, he didn't have time to be an eligible bachelor.

questions.text: What is Hundred's codename used by his security detail?
questions.explanation:
Superman.

	"Superman is headed to the roof!" is overheard when Hundred steps into an elevator. This surpises Padilla, who always saw Hundred as more of a Batman character.

questions.text: In the little more than three months he's been in office, how many weddings has Hundred performed, by his count?
questions.explanation:
Nineteen.

	"I've married more people than Elizabeth Taylor!" Hundred complains as he takes a smoke break with his deputy mayor, Dave Wylie.

questions.text: The first disemboweled body found in the subway is that of a:
questions.explanation:
Dog.

	The body is discovered by two workers working on the subway system, and are aptly horrified. The dog's chest was ripped open, exposing the innards.

questions.text: Jackson Georges went insane because of the alien fragment that gave Hundred his powers.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The alien fragment, as well as the shock of the 9/11 terrorist attacks, drove Georges insane. Georges had been trying to better understand Hundred's powers.

Gracie Mansion.

	Connie Georges stabbed herself with the fragment that gave Hundred his powers, and gained similar powers as a result. She was revealed to have been responsible for the brutal slayings underground.

questions.text: Wylie supports the idea of school vouchers when Hundred first proposes the idea.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Wylie is so opposed to the idea that he abruptly ends his smoke break with Hundred. Throughout the series, "Ex Machina" does not veer left or right in the American political spectrum.

questions.text: Hundred performs a gay marriage ceremony in the book. One of the men getting married is a firefighter.
questions.explanation:
True.

	One of Wylie's relatives wanted to marry his longtime boyfriend, and Hundred was happy to preside over the ceremony. Even though Hundred is wounded by an arrow, the ceremony goes through.

questions.text: Who asks Hundred about his sexual orientation towards the end of the book?
questions.explanation:
Suzanne Padilla.

	Hundred doesn't answer outright, but instead asks to be let into Padilla's apartment. Hundred's sexuality is up for debate throughout the series and is not answered in this book or in the following "Fact v. Fiction".
